normalised: **Social Media and Influencer Marketing: Virality Trends**

unnormalised: Hey folks, wanna know what's popping online? The virality landscape is shifting faster than a Mumbai local at rush hour! Forget those staged dance challenges; authenticity is the new black.
normalised: Hey folks, wanna know what is popping online? The virality landscape is shifting faster than a Mumbai local at rush hour! Forget those staged dance challenges; authenticity is the new black.

unnormalised: Think less "perfect influencer" and more "relatable Amrita sharing her mom's amazing rasam recipe." Remember the "Binod" trend? That was peak organic virality. Brands are now desperately trying to recreate that magic, often falling flat.
normalised: Think less "perfect influencer" and more "relatable Amrita sharing her mom's amazing rasam recipe." Remember the "Binod" trend? That was peak organic virality. Brands are now desperately trying to recreate that magic, often falling flat.

unnormalised: Currently, short-form video reigns supreme. Reels and TikTok are still king, but even WhatsApp statuses are seeing viral moments. Word of mouth is back, baby, but this time it spreads at the speed of 4G!
normalised: Currently, short-form video reigns supreme. Reels and TikTok are still king, but even WhatsApp statuses are seeing viral moments. Word of mouth is back, baby, but this time it spreads at the speed of four G!

unnormalised: Platforms are tweaking algorithms constantly, so what worked on 1st Jan 2023 might be ancient history by 14/07/2024. Stay agile, experiment like a scientist at IIT Delhi, and remember: content that resonates with Indian culture (think Diwali celebrations or cricket memes) has a higher chance of blowing up. Keep an eye on whatâ€™s trending around 17:00 hrs daily to catch the wave early. Just ask Pooja, her golgappa eating contest reel got her 100K followers within 24 hrs. Good luck catching that virality train!
normalised: Platforms are tweaking algorithms constantly, so what worked on first January two thousand and twenty three might be ancient history by fourteenth July two thousand and twenty four. Stay agile, experiment like a scientist at I I T Delhi, and remember: content that resonates with Indian culture (think Diwali celebrations or cricket memes) has a higher chance of blowing up. Keep an eye on what is trending around five P M daily to catch the wave early. Just ask Pooja, her golgappa eating contest reel got her one hundred thousand followers within twenty four hours. Good luck catching that virality train!
